rows.title: Feel the ground

transcript.eng:
Close your eyes.

Notice your connection with the ground beneath you. 
What parts of your body touch the ground? What parts of your body do not?  
Notice where it feels warm and where it feels cool. 
Feel the ground underneath you supporting you. Let your body sink into the support of the ground.

Try this next time you feel alone or are doing a mundane activity like washing up. It can really help!

rows.transcript:
Close your eyes.

Notice your connection with the ground beneath you. 
What parts of your body touch the ground? What parts of your body do not?  
Notice where it feels warm and where it feels cool. 
Feel the ground underneath you supporting you. Let your body sink into the support of the ground.

Try this next time you feel alone or are doing a mundane activity like washing up. It can really help!

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well. Keep up the good work.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: We all have better and worse days. The fact that you are here on this app shows courage and commitment!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Sorry to hear that things are difficult now. It is completely normal to struggle sometimes. Remember that you are not alone!

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Everyone feels stressed sometimes. Take a short walk to release your stress!

quiz_1_feedback_5.eng: Taking care of children can make you tired. Take a short power nap if you can!

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well. Keep up the good work.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_5: Taking care of children can make you tired. Take a short power nap if you can!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today we are learning about giving our children praise. 

Praise is good for building positive relationships, and is also helpful at encouraging good behaviour!

Well done for taking time to learn how to strengthen your relationship with your child. It shows you really care!

quiz_1_question.eng: How did the message above make you feel?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel proud.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel happy!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Sometimes being praised makes us feel embarrassed, usually because we are not used to it. It will get easier with practice! Giving praise helps children learn the behaviours you want to see.

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Sometimes, when we are praised for actions that we don't feel we deserve, we get sad. It is okay to feel sad, but remember that just being here is worthy of praise!

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel proud.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel happy!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Sometimes being praised makes us feel embarrassed, usually because we are not used to it. It will get easier with practice! Giving praise helps children learn the behaviours you want to see.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_4: Sometimes, when we are praised for actions that we don't feel we deserve, we get sad. It is okay to feel sad, but remember that just being here is worthy of praise!
rows.quiz_1_question: How did the message above make you feel?
rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today we are learning about giving our children praise. 

Praise is good for building positive relationships, and is also helpful at encouraging good behaviour!

Well done for taking time to learn how to strengthen your relationship with your child. It shows you really care!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
We all feel better when we are praised.

Praising your child when they behave well will make them want to behave that way more often. 

It also creates a positive and loving relationship between you.

Begin by praising your child during your one-on-one time.

media_title.eng: How will it help you and your family?

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

When was the last time you were praised? Can you praise yourself for something right now? Praise makes us all feel good. 

It is good to praise our children when they have done well, because when we do that, they will do more of that good behaviour we want to see.

And let's remember to praise ourselves too, for big or small things!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
We all feel better when we are praised.

Praising your child when they behave well will make them want to behave that way more often. 

It also creates a positive and loving relationship between you.

Begin by praising your child during your one-on-one time.
rows.media_title: How will it help you and your family?
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

When was the last time you were praised? Can you praise yourself for something right now? Praise makes us all feel good. 

It is good to praise our children when they have done well, because when we do that, they will do more of that good behaviour we want to see.

And let's remember to praise ourselves too, for big or small things!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s see how a father praises his daughter, @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name during one-on-one time.

character_1_text.eng: You found one blue slipper and one with stripes. Let’s find slippers that match and place them neatly on the shoe rack.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s see how a father praises his daughter, @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name during one-on-one time.
rows.character_1_text: You found one blue slipper and one with stripes. Let’s find slippers that match and place them neatly on the shoe rack.

character_1_text.eng: Another slipper! This one is white. It’s frustrating to try to find a matching pair when there are so many house slippers on the floor.

rows.character_1_text: Another slipper! This one is white. It’s frustrating to try to find a matching pair when there are so many house slippers on the floor.

character_1_text.eng: You are being very patient and looking very hard, @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name. Well done for trying. I am happy you are helping me.

rows.character_1_text: You are being very patient and looking very hard, @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name. Well done for trying. I am happy you are helping me.

character_1_text.eng:
You found two slippers with the same colour! Well done for not giving up, @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name! 

Because you helped me so well, I now have 5 extra minutes to play with you. What would you like to play?

rows.character_1_text:
You found two slippers with the same colour! Well done for not giving up, @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name! 

Because you helped me so well, I now have 5 extra minutes to play with you. What would you like to play?

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s reflect on what we saw.

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: To boost her self-esteem and confidence

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Exactly! When @data.characters.f1_father.name praises @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name, she feels good about herself.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: To make her feel good about herself.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Not exactly, but the praise does help her deal with his frustration. When @data.characters.f1_father.name praises @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name, they want to keep looking for the slipper!

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: To encourage him to work harder

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Not exactly, but the praise will help her want to help more often. When @data.characters.f1_father.name praises @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name, she will remember being praised and be more likely to help her father in the future!

quiz_2_question.eng: What can we learn from @data.characters.f1_father.name in how he praises @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: He yells so she is sure to hear him.

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: False. @data.characters.f1_father.name doesn’t yell at all but he does go down to @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name’s level. This is important so he can connect to her. @data.characters.f1_father.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: He uses her name and makes eye contact

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: True! All @data.characters.f1_father.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: He tells her she is a “good girl”.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: False. @data.characters.f1_father.name praises her daughter for something specific and provides the praise immediately. This shows us that the way we give praise is important for it to be effective.

quiz_2_option_4_text.eng: He praises her for the process of trying and not for the result.

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: True! All @data.characters.f1_father.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important.

quiz_2_option_5_text.eng: He does not criticise his mistake

quiz_2_feedback_5.eng: True! All @data.characters.f1_father.name’s actions show us that how we give praise is also important.

quiz_3_question.eng: Why does @data.characters.f1_father.name give @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name a hug and extra playtime together?

quiz_3_feedback_1.eng: The hug does show love, but it also rewards her for helping him. Giving a simple reward helps our children to do things that may be difficult for them again.

quiz_3_option_2_text.eng: So that she knows that she doesn’t have to help anymore again.

quiz_3_feedback_2.eng: Actually, the hug will encourage her to help again next time! Giving a simple reward helps our children to do things that may be difficult for them again.

quiz_3_option_3_text.eng: To encourage her to stay patient

quiz_3_feedback_3.eng: That’s right, giving a simple reward helps our children to do things that may be difficult for them again.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Exactly! When @data.characters.f1_father.name praises @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name, she feels good about herself.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Not exactly, but the praise does help her deal with his frustration. When @data.characters.f1_father.name praises @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name, they want to keep looking for the slipper!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Not exactly, but the praise will help her want to help more often. When @data.characters.f1_father.name praises @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name, she will remember being praised and be more likely to help her father in the future!

rows.quiz_1_option_2_text: To make her feel good about herself.
rows.quiz_1_option_3_text: To encourage him to work harder

rows.quiz_2_feedback_1: False. @data.characters.f1_father.name doesn’t yell at all but he does go down to @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name’s level. This is important so he can connect to her. @data.characters.f1_father.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important.

rows.quiz_2_option_3_text: He tells her she is a “good girl”.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_3: False. @data.characters.f1_father.name praises her daughter for something specific and provides the praise immediately. This shows us that the way we give praise is important for it to be effective.
rows.quiz_2_option_4_text: He praises her for the process of trying and not for the result.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_4: True! All @data.characters.f1_father.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important.
rows.quiz_2_option_5_text: He does not criticise his mistake
rows.quiz_2_feedback_5: True! All @data.characters.f1_father.name’s actions show us that how we give praise is also important.
rows.quiz_3_question: Why does @data.characters.f1_father.name give @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name a hug and extra playtime together?
rows.quiz_3_feedback_1: The hug does show love, but it also rewards her for helping him. Giving a simple reward helps our children to do things that may be difficult for them again.
rows.quiz_3_option_2_text: So that she knows that she doesn’t have to help anymore again.
rows.quiz_3_feedback_2: Actually, the hug will encourage her to help again next time! Giving a simple reward helps our children to do things that may be difficult for them again.
rows.quiz_3_option_3_text: To encourage her to stay patient
rows.quiz_3_feedback_3: That’s right, giving a simple reward helps our children to do things that may be difficult for them again.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are some easy tips for how to use praise:

section_1_text.eng: Look for anything good or helpful that your child does or tries to do when you want to praise them.

section_1_extra_text.eng:
Pause and really notice when they are doing something positive. Even if it’s expected of them.

Praise your child for *trying*. This boosts their self-esteem and confidence, which helps them to learn new behaviours.

section_2_text.eng: Praise them when you see them do something you like. Do this every day – even if it’s something really small.

section_2_extra_text.eng:
Tell them specifically what they have done well.

Be enthusiastic and really mean it!

You can show your praise with a big smile and words.

section_3_text.eng: Give your child a simple, free reward to encourage them to do more of the behaviours that you have praised them for.

section_3_extra_text.eng:
Rewards should be simple and free. 

Give your child a hug, extra playtime together, or make their favourite meal. 

Simple rewards can be a big motivation for your child to keep trying and show more positive behaviour.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are some easy tips for how to use praise:
rows.section_1_text: Look for anything good or helpful that your child does or tries to do when you want to praise them.
rows.section_1_extra_text:
Pause and really notice when they are doing something positive. Even if it’s expected of them.

Praise your child for *trying*. This boosts their self-esteem and confidence, which helps them to learn new behaviours.
rows.section_2_text: Praise them when you see them do something you like. Do this every day – even if it’s something really small.
rows.section_2_extra_text:
Tell them specifically what they have done well.

Be enthusiastic and really mean it!

You can show your praise with a big smile and words.
rows.section_3_text: Give your child a simple, free reward to encourage them to do more of the behaviours that you have praised them for.
rows.section_3_extra_text:
Rewards should be simple and free. 

Give your child a hug, extra playtime together, or make their favourite meal. 

Simple rewards can be a big motivation for your child to keep trying and show more positive behaviour.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Curious to see how praise can help you and your family?

Your home activity is to praise your child for 3 things every day, and praise yourself too for all your hard work being a parent – you deserve it!

quiz_1_question.eng:
What is one behaviour your child regularly shows in their daily routine that you can praise them for?
There are lots of right answers to this one!

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_1_option_5_text.eng: Getting ready for school or bed

quiz_1_feedback_5.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_1_feedback_6.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_2_question.eng: Remember to also praise yourself for the good work you're doing! What’s one way you can reward yourself for your hard work as a parent?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: Treat yourself to something you enjoy (e.g., a favourite snack or activity)

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Great choice! Taking time to enjoy something you love is a wonderful way to recharge and recognize your efforts as a parent.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: Take a few minutes to relax (e.g., meditation, a short walk, or just some quiet time)

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Well done! Giving yourself a moment to relax is so important. You’re doing a great job, and it’s okay to take a break.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: Celebrate by acknowledging your achievements (e.g.talking to a friend)

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Fantastic! Reflecting on your accomplishments helps you see how much you’re doing right. You deserve to celebrate your hard work!

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: Do something fun with your child that you both enjoy

quiz_2_option_5_text.eng: Wonderful choice! Sharing a fun activity with your child not only rewards you but also strengthens your bond. You’re doing an amazing job!

quiz_2_feedback_6.eng: Great idea! However you choose to reward yourself, it’s important to acknowledge the effort you put into parenting. You deserve it!

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_4: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!
